sources.title: Cannabis laws of Canada by province or territory

main_articles.title: Cannabis laws of Canada by province or territory

notes_main_articles.title: Cannabis laws of Canada by province or territory

notes_text: Legal for medicinal purposes since 2001 and for recreational purposes since 17 October 2018. The age to buy or consume cannabis varies by province: 19 in most provinces, 18 in Alberta, and 21 in Quebec.
notes: Legal for medicinal purposes since 2001 and for recreational purposes since 17 October 2018. The age to buy or consume cannabis varies by province: 19 in most provinces, 18 in Alberta, and 21 in Quebec.
notes_raw: {{Main|Cannabis in Canada|Cannabis laws of Canada by province or territory}} Legal for medicinal purposes since 2001 and for recreational purposes since 17 October 2018. The age to buy or consume cannabis varies by province: 19 in most provinces, 18 in Alberta, and 21 in Quebec.<ref>{{cite web |title=Cannabis Legalization and Regulation |url=https://www.justice.gc.ca/eng/cj-jp/cannabis/ |publisher=Department of Justice, Government of Canada |date=7 July 2021 |access-date=29 June 2023 }}</ref>
